intro: Moraea garipensis, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive cup-shaped structure. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in the Western and Eastern Cape provinces. Moraea garipensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
